Reviews.Title: “double room”
Reviews.Author: fahad92
Reviews.Content: i stay in this hotel on 2nd of feburary room was very tidy,neat & clean decorated with 40 inch plasma LCD.helpful staff, the rooms are little small but it did the job.i came all the way from china very long 14 hours flight & i had a wonderful plus very comfortable sleep here in this hotel.i would like to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: nsison1
Reviews.Content: This review is mainly for the customer service at Chester Hotel. Unfortunately, I was unable to make my stay at their hotel for my trip to London due to some customs/tickets issues when travelling from France to the UK. It was a Sunday morning and as soon as I found out I was not able to go, I called the Chester Hotel and spoke to Alli regarding a refund for my two booked nights. As a courtesy, they were able to refund only one night (Monday) and charge me for the Sunday night reservation (since it was within a 3 day cancellation policy). Alli said that he would speak to his Manager on Monday and see if they are able to refund Sunday night as well due to the special circumstance I had with my tickets. Monday came, and I called again and spoke with Alli. He remembered me right away and said he is waiting for his manager to come in so that he can speak with him regarding my situation. Several hours later, I get a phone call and it is Alli. He he advised me that his Manager approved the refund and that all money has been returned. I'm in SAles and customer service is an absolute must!! I am extremely satisfied with the service that was given to me! Not even staying there, I give this place a 5+ because of the great service. The next time I plan a trip to the UK I will come back and try my stay here at Chester. Thank you Alli and your Manager for such great service! I will recommned you to all who is visiting London! On a side note, we chose this hotel becasue of the great location! Its several minutes from Victoria STation and if you book tours, the bus picks you up very close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Bluecatcottage
Reviews.Content: On the plus side: good location, good value for money, helpful staff, easy free parking right outside (evenings and weekends), effort had been made on the soft furnishings, and it was reasonably clean. On the minus side: bathroom had a nasty whiff of sewage, broken shower fitting meant you had to manually hold the shower over your head (or between your knees when you needed to use your hands to wash your hair etc), missing bits of ceiling coving and gaps in tiles, at carpet edges etc undermined the efforts that had been made with new curtains and bed linen. However I was only here for one night and it was very, very cheap (£30 for a small family room with 2 double beds, room no 4, apparently the best room, ). However, in future I think I would prefer to pay another £20 and get a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not even for a weekend”
Reviews.Author: tinamclure69
Reviews.Content: given family room and told no ceiling light so standard lamp supplied. Ceiling light had one bulb working. Fridge not working cos std lamp plugged in. en suite very cosy!!!!! Toilet seat broken and cracked so you couldn't sit on it. stairs had spindles missing so a child could easily fall through. had to ask for tea/ coffee and told only coffee available. step to bathroom broken off. won't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Warm”
Reviews.Author: BOURNEinTREADSTONE
Reviews.Content: Warmly welcome, homely atmosphere and a pleasant stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sm0kin4ces
Reviews.Content: Rooms are at reasonable prices. Only stayed for a night to crash with my girlfriend. Near both train and bus stations; 2 min walk. You got lots of shops and takeaway restuarants near the hotel. Recommend

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: imran K
Reviews.Content: i stay in buget room very small box room but very nice decorade plus neat and clean i will stay again in dis hotel again before i see reviews i was bit worried but hotel is totally different . i was very tired that night. but i got very good sleep in box room i recmond dis hotel only i have complain about ealry check out.

Reviews.Title: “A good service at a low price..”
Reviews.Author: Waqyy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights nd got a very good service.. Especially the people at the reception.. Hey ppl it was very good service at a low price.. I saw sum comments on the back garden.. I took some pics too.. I din see any rubbishh.. Cheerz..

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic City + Fantastic Hotel = Fantastic Holiday!”
Reviews.Author: bigdaddie
Reviews.Content: Room - I stayed in a double bedroom, fairly spacious with good facitlities (Bathroom/toilet) as expected from a 3 star Hotel. Cleanliness - I have been travelling around for the last few months and I must say, this is on the much better scale of a budget room. Bathroom was given an uplift and maintained well. Staff - Friendly and happy to assist. First night I requested a change in pillow and was welcomed by a quick service. All in all, good value for money in a very good location. Would stay again in future visits. Recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Bazing
Reviews.Content: Very good service and felt very accommodated. Thoroughly enjoyed my stay and would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, rude, un-attentive, un-trustworthy staff :o( Good location.”
Reviews.Author: jennifer o
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review before but i thought i would alert people to the disappointment that we felt on arrival of our first trip away together. The location was fairly good but it pretty much stops there. The room was bright and not badly decorated but it was small and the bathroom was not a luxury tiled bathroom as advertised but a plastic cubical/pod that was ridiculous in size. The shower didnt work properly and was literally over the toilet and there was no toilet roll on arrival and no towels on the second night. We are down to earth people and were quite happy with the room and also happy with the small details of the misleading pictures of the bathroom, we actually laughed it off given that we didnt pay a through the nose but it was the staff's attitudes that spoilt our trip. I dont expect anything special but even just to be civil would have made all the difference. We arrived an hour early and approached the desk where i was called mr neil three times (Its miss O'Neill). I corrected him several times stating the booking was in my name to which he said i had not made a booking. Then i showed confirmation and i was told that i only had a room for one night. I had actually booked for 3. Once this was dealt with he asked the maid if the room was ready and she clearly said "yes" but he said we were to early and would have to come back in an hour. We asked could we leave our cases and he was tutting and sighing about this and just pointed to a corner by some stairs. Even then we didnt think much of it and were glad to just be there and off load our cases. We attempted to get our coats out of the cases due to there being a thunder storm outside and our money and he stood over us while we were doing this saying "just leave them there" and sighing like it was a major issue. After the third time of saying it, i became quite pressured and offended and had to look up at him and say "we are just getting some money and our coats as its raining outside, is that okay". He backed off a little then. We tried to forget this first impression and eventually got back soaked through in an hours time and was looking forward to seeing our room and getting dried off. Again the staff were rude and it was someone else at the desk who proceeded to call me mr neil and again said there was no booking made for a miss o'neill, then eventually found my booking details and again said i had booked for one night. We finally just got a key handed to us but no directions to our room. The lack of hospitality was unreal and we felt deflated and uncomfortable. We had to go down and ask for toilet roll to which the male member off staff was huffing and puffing and just shouted to the house keeper who passed us one with no expression, just didnt even speak. The second night we asked for towels as we had none at all in our room. The same house keeper just mumbled something in polish pulling faces and passed over 'one' hand towel. We had to say that there was two of us staying and we needed bath towels for a shower. Again she mumbled something in her own language and reluctantly passed two towels over. We went for a romantic trip and ended up being upset and annoyed by the treatment of the staff. After coming home i had wished that i had said something at the time but i just didnt want to ruin our trip and have to dread returning to the hotel in the evenings. We asked could we leave our bag on our departure day for two hours as we were told when booking that this wouldnt be a problem but the member of staff looked disgusted at us and just kept repeating how long for? he must have asked us four times and then shouted after us on our way out the door ..................... "just two hours". Again i was upset by this and pretended to my partner that i didnt hear what he said for fear of him having a row with him as i could see he was really wound up by the poor service at this time, as i was. On our return for our bags they actually just ignored us like they couldnt even see us. No good bye, no thanks for staying, no general hospitality. I had some shoes stolen from our room during our stay which i didnt realise until i unpacked my bag after my return. I had just presumed that my partner had packed them away as we didnt trust the staff while we were there so we left everything in the case during the day time and locked the case only leaving a few items out such as jackets and shoes. Utterly shocking really and im just glad we didnt leave the case open or unpack our belongings, also that the shoes were not too expensive. We had a lovely trip but would never stay there again unless the management had changed hands. I tried to put it down to their lack of English at the time and we were convincing each other that they may have been acting appropriately for a hotel owner in their culture/country but at the end of the day, this is England and i have never been treated like that in any of the many hotels that i have stayed in before. It saddens me to think that people may travel from all different parts of the world to the capital of our country and be treated and greeted by such disappointing attitudes. The smoke alarm was in the bedside draw along side some pubic hair and a ball of chewing gum.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Jenny010101
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review here before however this hotel was terrible so I wanted to let people know. I would not say I am a particulary fussy person hotel wise, having spent a lot of time in youth hostels however, this hotel was not acceptable by anyone's standards. The first night I was in a ground floor room which I didn't think was acceptable as a female sole traveller. I had to go outside and tell the hotel staff to be quiet at midnight however the noise continued. As well as this, as my room was next too the front door there was continual noise throughout the night from the door as well as loud neighbours. On the second night I requested to be moved to another room. In this room the carpets were filthy and the toilet and shower were almost on top of each other. The hotel was generally in a terrible state, the staff were unhelpful and I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I don't recommend it”
Reviews.Author: melaniev v
Reviews.Content: We went there two times (oct and Dec 2010) First time: We chose it because it was cheap and close to the train station. I read very bad comments on this website but decided to go. We arrived in the reception (strange room in the basement, we did not know if this was the reception or the staff's appartment.) The room was very small, the bed too (maybe for one person and a half). It was not very very clean and some things should have been fixed. We didn't have hot water in the shower, so we decided to go to the shared bathroom downstairs. There was water everywhere on the floor, not very clean, but the water was a bit hotter. Second time: We came to this hotel because I was not sure it was the same as the first time and I got a nice price on the internet. When we arrived, the room was not ready, so we let our luggage and left for a walk in the surroundings. The room was very very small, we could hardly cross each other. The bathroom was quite nice and modern . The day of check-out, they made us leave before 10am as they needed the room to make some works (whereas we had to wait for a room at our arrival...) To conclude, it may be not the worst hotel in London but I don't recommend it and I think we can find better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value . good Location, and not a bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ali A
Reviews.Content: after reading all the comments i regretted bookin a room here.. but decided to stick with it as i was only goin to stay there for a night NOT A BAD HOTEL, the Path to reception had mirror on the both sides, small but beauty fully decorated reception again room a little small and similarly bathroom was d size of an aircraft toilet Clean and Brilliantly decorated room with mirrors on the 3 sides, Very helpful staff Would recommend to others

Reviews.Title: “Poor service.....Tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: justme123186525
Reviews.Content: Don't Don't Don't book a room at the chester. Room was TINY , wasn't even a double bed. It was what I'd call a "queen size" bed (about 3/4 the size of a double) . As for the en-suite, well it looked like a shower room from a caravan. You can't eat or drink at the Chester...why it's called an Hotel is anyones guess. PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE take note of the reviews on here about the Chester and DON'T stay there.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!!!”
Reviews.Author: Podroznik_z_Polski
Reviews.Content: I asked for double room but we got room for one person with small bed. Room (no. 3) was dirty, dirty sheets, cups and spoons. They don't throw away the used platic spoons but "try" to clean them. Claustrofobic bathroom. Everthing was drity and awful! I regret I did't read the opinion on this hotel before our stay. It was the worst hotel I have ever been! Please, pay more and stay in another hotel. Don't make a mistake! The only advantages are free wi-fi and localisation (close to Victoria Station)

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay here again if you paid me”
Reviews.Author: halo2me
Reviews.Content: Pros It was cheap The guy on the desk was friendly Location was ok Cons -It was a basement room with no natural lighting except in the bathroom which had lots of natural lighting as there was no curtain - It smelt - either from a lack of circulation or damp - The walls were peeling plaster - The plug socket was damaged - The radiator was flaking rust I've never felt more uncomfortable in a hotel in my life. I was up at the crack of dawn the next morning in order to leave the place as I couldn't/wouldn't stay another minute

Reviews.Title: “tiny room, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: tamizer
Reviews.Content: The room was super tiny, as was the bathroom, luckily I am short so it didn't affect me at all. It was in an amazing location, a few blocks from Victoria Station, 15 minute walk to Buckingham Palace and a 20 minute walk to Parliament, Big Ben, London Eye, Westminster Abbey and Westminster Pier. You needed a key to enter and it was clean and quiet. I would recommend the hotel for location alone. Very affordable compared to other hotels in the vicinity and the person at the front desk allowed me to check in several hours early.

Reviews.Title: “Tired decor, weak service, but plenty going for it too.”
Reviews.Author: Angelophile
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as a last minute bolthole during a weekend in London. I was charged Â£20 (plus Â£3 booking fee) for what was described as a "box room" - basically a small-ish room with single bed, sink, tea making facilities and a shared toilet/bathroom. And I have to say, for Â£20 I found it exceptionally good value. I can see why other reviewers may have had problems with the hotel - the decor is tired and in desperate need of new carpets and a fresh lick of paint. The owner was friendly enough when I first arrived, but clearly more interested in the TV show he was watching than customer care. However, for Â£20 in central London, these complaints seem pretty minor! The room was clean, bedsheets and towel clean, despite the grubby looking, worn carpet and markings on the paintwork. Minor things, really, as the room was larger than I expected, with plenty of room to move about and hang up clothes. There was a TV in the room (which I didn't use). Flaws were that the sink was ridiculously small and "designer" and the shared toilet a couple of floors down in the basement. However, that was also very clean and had obviously been mopped that morning and a cleaner was hard at work when I arrived. The location is exceptionally convenient - only 5 minutes work from Victoria Station. You couldn't ask for better. Lots of nice bars and restaurants in the area too and the street was relatively quiet for central London. But the main advantage was the price. If I'd paid a lot for the room I would have been expecting more, but as a convenient place to crash for one night when in London, I couldn't have asked for more. It was a steal on LateRooms. I wouldn't look to stay there for an extended stay but for a weekend away it was perfectly acceptable for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for money, would definately stay again”
Reviews.Author: HugoHorton
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night to got to Wimbledon Tenis Championships. It was ideal for a stop over, no its not the Ritz but for the money it was great . The room was clean and tidy and the bathroon was small but very modern. The rooms you can see are being modernised so to be fair to the hotel it is trying to improve the accomadation. There wasn't a hairdryer in the room and my friend said no piont in asking as they wont have one. I went to recption and hay hoo they gave me a very modern on great stuff . We always stay in a 4/5 star hotel but on this occasion just wanted something cheap and cheerful as we were only sleeping one night and wanted to keep the cost down. I would definately stay again If there was one thing I would critise which is small was all the cups and suacers were old chipped and cracked so we had a coffe out off the drinking glasses.

Reviews.Title: “The room were smelling like there are some dead rats”
Reviews.Author: Spives
Reviews.Content: Very poor room cleaning the bath was so terrible no hot water the man at the reception looks like he ever clean himself. It's been 3 years from the reviews above he does not fix anything yet. These hotel most be out of trade.

Reviews.Title: “Poor as the service”
Reviews.Author: Spives
Reviews.Content: Very poor hotel and the service there was not any at all, the room paint its coming out of the wall and the room was a bathroom. Poor recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Vile, disgusting, rude staff and the floor fell off!”
Reviews.Author: will0w69
Reviews.Content: Shown to our first room, which was supposedly a double but that was roughly 5ft wide, most of which the bed took up. To sleep in the bed we would have had to sleep on top of each other it was that small. The sheets, covers and coverlet were covered in stains...don't even want to know what they were. The curtains were also stained, as well as the bolster uggg. The cups in this room were filthy and a teaspoon was stuck to the bottom of one of them, nice. Tried to go to the loo, which I'm sorry, but unless you're a 3ft tall, 6 inch wide contortionist, I would defy any average sized person to wedge onto. The shower "stall" was filthy and so tiny you would have had to stand outside said stall to have your shower. When my friend stepped out of bathroom a bit of the floor fell off. If I hadn't caught her in time she would have fallen backwards. So we went to reception and asked to change to a different room. The staff member we spoke to was extremely rude and basically blamed us for the state of the room and "why hadn't we said something before".....we'd been in it for a total of about 10 minutes, most of which time was spent being ridiculously British umming and arrring about complaining. However we struck up the courage and that was what we faced. He also told us they were fully booked. Strange then that we were shown two empty rooms by a different member of staff who told us there were two free rooms we could look at :-/ The first of these had nasty stains on the bed covers (what a shocka!!) and damp rising up the wall like a brown cloud. Yeah, no, not happening. So we were shown to a third room, also with the apparently requisite stains on the coverlet and pillow covers but joy of joys clean sheets! It also had a clean cushion so I used that to sleep on. The bathroom was a good size and apparently clean, however there was zero water pressure. We said we would accept this room and were shouted at by the first member of staff that if we accepted this room now we forfeited any right to complain and change our minds. The reception area was tiny and stranger than strange, there was a frame on the wall....framing the wall, no picture, no mirror, just the wall behind....maybe I just have no appreciation of modern art.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Stephx21
Reviews.Content: Stayed there earlier this month after searching on the internet for cheap London hotels. Found this one offering a discounted price of Â£45 for one night, and after looking at pictures thought it looked like great value for money. Finding it was easy enough once I'd found directions, but it looked more like a B&B than a hotel. Was greeted by staff/owner at door who was sarcastic. We were shown to our room by a nice lady, but the room looked nothing like what was offered on the internet-turns out t seems all photos on here are deceiving. Room was tiny with a very small 'double' bed. The bedding was stained with brown marks which we can only hope was chocolate, and the bathroom was tiny. That being said, the shower was warm. There was no satellite TV as advertised. Was woken by a knock on the door with the man who originally greeted us shouting telling us we had to be out by 10.30am. The room had been booked until 11am. When we asked if we could leave our bags somewhere whilst we went and had breakfast, the man made it apparent that this would be an inconvenience but did allow us to until 1pm. When we went to collect the bag, the man was nowhere to be seen and we were greeted by the woman. She was lovely and it's a shame she doesn't run it as it would have been a much nicer stay had this been the case. Overall, very disappointing stay and as it was supposed to be a birthday trip to London it took the shine off it. Would not go here again, and wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID!! Filthy, no hot water, rude staff, dirty sheets”
Reviews.Author: Laurabristol11
Reviews.Content: This place is uttery vile. My room was tiny, had to walk sideways to walk round the bed, the floor was covered in hair and even had a dried out chunk of cucumber on it. The sheets and cover had what looked like semen on it. Staff were rude, I asked them to vacuum it but they didnt. No hot water in the evening, had to have cold shower. Stay away from this place!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: AshStuff
Reviews.Content: After reading some bad reviews I was worried about this hotel but to be honest its fine and good value for the price. I paid Â£39 for a single room. The actual room was small with modern decoration (poor finish) a bed which was either a 3/4 or a double, small tv and on-suite unit (like the one piece bathroom unites you get in university accommodation). The location was perfect for me and for the price I can't complain (If your after luxury stay else where and pay for it), I will be staying again next month

Reviews.Title: “BAD NEWS”
Reviews.Author: tjmjj
Reviews.Content: I booked a Quad for one night, Well mmmmm rooms looked ok, a little dirty. First problem if you want the quad or the triple be aware its 2 double beds in both a triple and the quads weird. Second problem you have to be 6 foot tall to turn tv over, Third Mouse trap with Poison in it. I was with my Wife and my 12 year old son and my 2 year old daughter (Mouse Poison) in a room they know children are going to be in. Went to theater got kids into to bed son with me daughter with the wife, i was woke up to a loud dripping noise, as it was raining outside it started to rain inside the room onto my wife and daughters bed,this was at 3.15am. I went to get the night porter who I found asleep on a mattress behind the reception desk, after the third attempt of waking him my sister who was in the room above us also went down to the porter he just handed her a key for me to go and sleep in a room on my own without my family, he came to our room handed me a key then went back to the reception and fell back to sleep, The porter had more sleep than me and I was paying. I went to the reception to complain again and I was offered a discount, I refused that and demanded a full refund or I would call the police with that the porter called his boss and a full refund was given. Never never again Im so tired

Reviews.Title: “The most awful hotel in London, this shouldn't be legally trading”
Reviews.Author: cotswoldfoodie11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the most AWFUL experience ever, we saw there were some positive reviews and thought let's give it a try. It was a nightmare to find and then we checked in and on first impressions were getting slightly worried, we were given our room keys and the door to the room was so small we couldnt get both our luggage through it. After squeezing in the room we were what can only be described as utterly disgusted!!! There were live wires hanging out the wall. The toilet which was as big as a portaloo, about a 30cm space to shower, smelt like a sewer. There were 2 mouldy cups on the side, mould on the carpets, the bed sheets had someone elses hair on it and was by no means clean and looked like it hadn't been cleaned for a while. We couldn't stay at the hotel and shortly left, i was itching all day and night and hate to think if we stayed there what we would have caught. We got a full refund as my partner didn't really give them a choice. Please see the photos to clarify why you should NEVER stay here. Save up for another month and go to the Hilton because this place shouldn't be legal and trust me the London Tourist Board will be hearing about this. So thanks to the Chester Hotel, I NEVER want to return to London.

Reviews.Title: “Room 16 - 'The Cell'”
Reviews.Author: chestertouristcom
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a little difficult to find, it is located half way down a side road (Longmoore Street) a mile west from the City of London five minutes walk from Victoria Coach/Train Station. It has a lit sign sticking out from the front of the hotel. The hotel is a Victorian terraced building located in a mixed residential/hotel street. There is no kitchen or food facilities. There is a small kettle and cup in each room, one instant coffee packet and two tea bags provided (not replaced on the second night). Sainsbury's supermarket is a minutes walk around the corner (open until 11pm). There is a pub across the street called 'The Prince of Wales'. Access to the rooms is by Yale lock, you also get a key to the yale lock for the front door for 24 hour access. Reception and check in closes 11pm strictly (reception desk opens around 8am). Check out is by 10am. There is a large private underground car park five minutes walk called Pimlico Car Park (Â£40 for 48 hours, no return). There is free on-street parking in front of the hotel after 6pm but it was full of cars on my visit. Room 8 is a double en-suite down stars 10 foot by 10 foot. Room 8 has a small double bed, a flat screen TV (Digital Freeview) with a bathroom/shower cubicle. Room was nicely decorated but the bed sheets were stained and the pillows stunk. Room 16 is a single off suite in the basement 6 foot by 6 foot! Room 16 is like a prison cell, no outside window, just an internal window facing the corridor, cold at night, central heating not switched on, just an electrical oil radiator for heating. Cup was chipped and paint was pealing off the ceiling and walls. Sheets were clean and the room was cleaned about 9am in the morning. There is a shared bathroom next door. Other hotel guests ran off all the hot water in the morning, so we had to have a cold shower. The hotel is poor overall, the owners don't put much effort/care into running it.

Reviews.Title: “RAT INFESTED HOTEL - PLEASE DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: dvdvns
Reviews.Content: Reasons not to stay: 1. Rats in the room, which the receptionist had no interest in 2. Room is like a steam room at night 3 Unable to sleep as receptionist watching TV very loudly at night 4.Rude and obnoxious staff 5.Light on constantly in the bathroom 6.Filthy rooms, dirty carpets and walls 7.Electrical maintenance taking place very loudly at 9.00am 8.Receptionist asleep while people outside ringing doorbell for 1/2 hr at 4.00am THIS IS THE SINGLE WORST HOTEL I HAVE EVER STAYED IN. PAY MORE AND GO ELSEWHERE

Reviews.Title: “disgusting and ugly "HOTEL"”
Reviews.Author: elvisprecel
Reviews.Content: I have never been to so awful â€œhotelâ€�. They gave me overgrown with mold room in pavement. With no windows! I felt like in a small, dirty, and damp cave. The photos on the website donâ€™t reflect roomsâ€™ condition at all! Iâ€™ll never go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting beyond belief”
Reviews.Author: Calpemountain
Reviews.Content: Basement room 7 was simply the most disgusting room I have ever been booked into. How the receptionist had the nerve to suggest anyone should pay to stay there is simply beyond belief. The small double bed was pushed up against a damp/mould stained outside wall, the room was stuffy, stifling hot with the distinct smell of damp. A tall mirror was balanced against another wall in a vain attempt to cover blown plaster pealing off the wall behind it from floor to ceiling. The tea/coffee mugs and kettle were on the floor next to the bed. I'm not fussy and I was tired and desperate to relax after a long day at work made worse by being greeted first by an "empty" reception desk for half an hour therefore kept waiting whilst the receptionist had taken it into his head to leave the desk to search for a lost guest abandoning his post at around mid-night.

Reviews.Title: “Warning! Do not stay at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: buddhazg2003
Reviews.Content: Warning! Do not stay at this hotel. Worst hotel ever! Smal,dirty,smelly room and bathroom. Unkind staff. The bathroom looks like the airplane lavatory. I am happy that I didnt get a skin disease in this hotel. Good location is not good enough reason to stay at this hotel. Public transportation is excellent in London and you can very quickly reach the city center and all attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Warning. Do not stay here.”
Reviews.Author: RevenHinaGeKhaled
Reviews.Content: Ok you have been warned so stay at your own risk if you do wish to do so. I am still recovering. Let me start, well I arrived in London from Berkshire with my fiancÃ©; he had brought last minute tickets to see Wicked in the weekend so we wanted a hotel close by. When I googled there were a few that came up but this was the only one with rooms available so I called and booked after checking out the website which by the way is a complete misguided view, but for the price i paid, well I was at least expecting something half decent. What did I get though; something entirely different. I won't waffle on, We stayed for 1 night but in that night I was moved to 3 different rooms, once woken up whilst we were sleeping as there had been a mistake and I should have been in another room. Well all 3 rooms were disgusting, 2 had en-suites or cupboards with showers in them I would prefer to describe it as. The showers had no hot water, that was my fault as I was apparently told that there would be hot water only from 7am to 8am only. The carpets were rotten and smelt of mould and the mattresses were sagging and squeaky. I was almost relieved to see clean sheets, although this didn't make me feel any better. The ceilings had damp in corners and I was afraid it would cave in at any point. And the smell in the toilet made me think nobody had cleaned it in years, I don't even know how to describe the stench, I felt sick. Lastly the service, it was the worst part of my experience, I got shouted at by two men that could barely speak English just for asking for something clearly within my rights. When I demanded to speak to somebody who could speak English, I had to wait until 2pm, 4 hours after I'd checked out but I was determined to get a refund so I stayed and missed my train. Well when the young man turned up, who I can only assume is a family member of the owner, well he barely said a thing to me except he could not refund me or give me any money back and then he just ignored me until k got fed up and left. I am warning everyone, please do not stay here. Quite frankly, I have stayed in travellers hostels abroad better than this back in the 90's when I travelled eastern Asia as a student, that's saying something. The only other guest I met there during my stay was as angry as me but could barely speak any English so got treated worse than I had. The room I was kicked out from was occupied by one of the 2 members of staff and his girlfriend where they'd had sex very loudly, I heard the entire session and was quite embarrassed to say the least. I rarely complain but I am so outraged at my experience that I am trying to find out if there is a tourist board that can help so that nobody else has to endure what I did.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID AT ALL COSTS”
Reviews.Author: Bozle
Reviews.Content: Booked this last minute as I needed a crash for one night before an interview in London. Thought I was getting a cheap deal. i was WRONG!! I wouldn't stay here again if THEY paid ME! It was filthy, absolutely filthy, I slept on top of the bed sheets in a bunch of jumpers because there were little black hairs in the bed. There was no lock on the door and I felt very unsafe, lots of movement and noise outside my door so I put furniture up against it. Still felt unsafe. My room was right next to reception and it was VERY loud, especially at 2am when someone rang the door bel constantly then had a argument with the staff right outside my door. The staff were horrible, very unfriendly, as though you being there was an inconvenience and annoyance to them! As another reviewer has said DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, awful service”
Reviews.Author: Dan_James
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on the day as I needed a place to crash for one night and the guy on the phone who took my credit card details was very abrupt and didn't really have any manners. Arrived - really good location, about 5 minutes good walk from Victoria with nice places along the way to drink and eat, as well as a Sainbury's. The guy who checked me in was talking on the phone a bit in another language he gave me the key and receipt and had charged me Â£30 instead of the Â£27 advertised and said on the phone. I questioned and said there was a Â£3 credit card charge which I wasn't told about. He called the person who took the original call who agreed to refund and I paid Â£27 in cash. The room was just a bed and table but I knew this - hence why it was so cheap and it did the job. The bathroom next door was odd shaped and I couldn't stand properly in the bath to shower because of the low ceiling. No towel in there either. The place itself wasn't the quietest and building work was clear - bits of dust and whatnot over the floor. On the day I left, I was still in my room at 10.45pm packing for the 11pm checkout and another member of staff, maybe owner, knocked on my door and barked 'WHEN you leaving?!' and I replied '10 minutes' - not impressed. The staff generally were so disinterested and it seemed inconvenienced whenever you asked/spoke to them. However, the location is great so if you simply need a cheap place to crash in Victoria, this does the job.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay in London close to Victoria Station”
Reviews.Author: Kappura
Reviews.Content: I was suprised to read the earlier negative comments about the hotel since I had a very pleasant stay here! I would definitely recommend this hotel to any couple/a few friends travelling together! Me and my friend stayd at the Chester hotel for one night, after having the worst experience ever at another hotel close by the night before... We hadn't booked anything in advance but got a room right away. The room that we stayd in was newly renovated and was fresh, clean and with an own bathroom. The staff was helpful and nice. A big plus for the nice decorations in reception and in the room, cosy!

Reviews.Title: “Great for one night on your own”
Reviews.Author: Olgba
Reviews.Content: I was back to UK from long 40 -hour coach trip ( bloody volcanic ash made me do this)and needed just a bed close to Victoria cos my train was for next morning from Victoria Station.....I paid 38 pounds and had no complains.....tiny and not very clean room, small shower, but friendly staff speaking hindu or something like that....comfi bed though....and kettle next to it with tea bags and coffee...no complaints at all!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: angelstarEngland
Reviews.Content: The worste hotel i've ever stayed in. The room was tiny and freezing cold and there was damp dripping off the walls and ceiling. Apart from all that, when i checked out the staff there accused me of having another person stay with me (which was not the case) and after i left they charged my card without my knowledge or authorisation an extra Â£50. As a young girl on my own i feel they took advantage of me and I am currently seeking compensation from them. Stay here at your own risk.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY! BOOK AT YOUR OWN RISK!”
Reviews.Author: Twifan85
Reviews.Content: This hotel was horrible! The man (or men as there was several of them) that worked/owned the hotel were rude and mean, they all spoke to each other in a different language while you were in the same room and it was very unnerving. I came with my young sister to go to the New Moon UK fan event that we had won tickets too and this hotel ruined the night for us. We were even too scared to return there after the event! On arriving we were told our hotel room was not ready, this is when the guy in the smelly dark basement room (his office) told us he would order a taxi for us, we then waited for our taxi outside and after 20 mins a normal car pulled up and said he would be picking us up! But before he drove off he ran inside and talked to the owner of the hotel, it turned out it was his friend! We were quoted Â£9 by a black cab for this journey, but when we arrived at the event the driver turned around and asked for Â£25!! Con-Artist!! The room we stayed in was a double en-suite and it was what I would describe as a poo hole, the toilet leaked, there was cracks in the wall, it smelled and had a filthy carpet! The owner also thought it would be a good idea to hoover outside our room at 7.00 in the morning (lucky we had got up a hour before to get the heck out of there asap). the owner then grunted what sounded like a goodbye and we hurried away from the worst hotel Ive ever stayed in. London and fan event was great, but the Chester Hotel was the work of the devil.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maddison13
Reviews.Content: Reception in dark and dingy basement. Wires exposed from sockets. Window would not shut. Sink was not attached to wall securely, and tap wobbled. Dirty bed linen, thin duvet, no blanket and was cold. Very uncomfortable bed, and no headboard. Carpet stained. Rubbish dump for a back yard. I did not have an en suite room, and the trek to bathroom was ridiculously long, and when I found it, it was dirty and smelly. Construction work going on, and in places nothing between you and the disgusting yard on the second floor other than a piece of clear plastic, plus there are different floor levels where I tripped, no carpet, or frayed carpet, narrow and un even staircases, no fire exits. They should be paying people to stay there, not the other way around.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Place on the Planet”
Reviews.Author: brpiazza
Reviews.Content: My mother stayed in this hotel when she came to visit me in London. It's close to my flat, it was a last minute booking and unfortunately we picked this money-saving piece of garbage. There was heavy rain the day before and because of this my mother was put into a room with lights hanging from long wires from the cieling. We were told this would be fixed that night....two days later.....they had not fixed it and the hotel toilet, across from my mothers room, was taped off and the strong smell of sewage had leaked into her room. They finally moved her. She was also given a hair dryer that broke immediately after using once. This can't really be considered a hotel because it's more like a bed and breakfast without any breakfast. It's a renovated house that's old, smelly, and dark. The rooms are small, the staff (for the most part) are rude, and there are no positives at all, besides the location. When I say rude staff it is due to the receptionist (older man) who glared at us for five minutes without speaking after we had asked a question about our room..we then just left the office feeling intimidated and angry. And when writing a complaint to the hotel and the booking agency we used the hotel responsed in a horribly rude way, not taking responsibility for ANYTHING, and blaming my mother for being difficult. So, let me ask you this. If you came to holiday in London and was given a room without main lights, dangling wires, a smelly bathroom across from you, and rude employees would you want your money back??? would you be upset?? Because I think that would be a pretty standard reaction.....

Reviews.Title: “Did it's job :)”
Reviews.Author: DitziTravel
Reviews.Content: We chose the Chester Hotel for it's location, as we were only staying one night, but needed somewhere inexpensive and close to the Tube. Check in was quick, and we were given a room key and a front door key, as we would be out late, and told which floor our room was on. The room was very basic, with a bed, TV and kettle, but clean, and we were given a free upgrade on check in, so we had an en-suite rather than a shared bathroom. The taps and shower were not that great, but served their purpose, and bed was very comfy. As the room was really just somewhere to change, shower and sleep after a night out DJing in town, we cannot really complain. We checked out at 8.30am, but were not given any details regarding breakfast on check in. When checking out we were told to just leave our keys by the door, which was lucky as there were no staff around. All in all, for one nights stay, the Chester Hotel sufficed, but probably would not stay there unless we would only be there from 3am until 8.30am again.

Reviews.Title: “Pay more to stay elsewhere nearby, seriously!”
Reviews.Author: Fiddlerf15
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at the Chester due to the great location near Wicked and the Victoria line. Don't make the same mistake unless you're just staying one night and don't need to shower. There are plenty of other hotels in the area. The rooms are newly painted, but they haven't been dusted in a while. The chandeliers are turning gray because of the accumulated dust. The toilet was cleaned daily and seemed sanitary. The shower pressure was abysmal. I could get more volume and pressure by pouring a bottle of water over myself. It was slightly more than a drip. The lock on the hollow-core door to the room was nearly detached. It was only held on by 2 screws...not the most secure feeling. When it rained, as it sometimes does in London, the ceiling began leaking over the TV & electrical outlets. Luckily, the dirty water heater came in handy. I used the pitcher to catch over 2 inches of raindrops overnight. But yes, the location is great. The Ale & Thai food in the pub across the street were top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasantly vile!”
Reviews.Author: RichiePearson
Reviews.Content: We went down to London for a night to see a show on the West End and OMG did this hotel ruin it! Working in a Hotel myself I know what to expect from different types of hotels/sectors and i can honestly say this is not budget or B&B i wouldn't even class it as a hostel. Its more of a grumpy old mans house, who can't make rent, so has gone down to the local second hand shop picked up a few grotty sheets thrown them in a room and put a lock on the door! We arrived at the hotel 2 hours before check-in and pressing the buzzer a man asks what we want, we reply checking in so he says "go away your 2 hours early" ..let that slide, asked if we could leave one bag AS IT SAID ON THE CONFIRMATION WE COULD, he said "no room, come see for yourself" so we go in to a cigarette stinking hallway, down into a dingy basement or 'reception' to be greeted by a RUDE, ABRUPT and GRUMPY old man (guessing the owner) who instead of greeting us just pointed to the room and said "see". After showing it was only a small shoulder bag he was like"Fine" and just pointed to a corner of the room. Then we went off to enjoy the city. When we needed to go back to check-in and get ready to go to the theatre my friend said he was scared to go back to the hotel. After checking-in we went to our room ..cupboard more like. The room was the same size as the bed with about a foot either side of it to move. A stained bedside table and a dirty sink in the corner. I didn't even dare drink from the coffee facilities provided. One of the two shared bathroom light did not work and the other the shower head was broke. The ONLY good thing about this hotel is its location. The good reviews about this hotel, i can only hazard a guess that someone related to the hotel has wrote them ..cos they are a load of rubbish!! My recommendation is DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The most disgusting hovel I've ever stepped foot in!”
Reviews.Author: mysterymember
Reviews.Content: I booked this room through laterooms.com at the last minute as a "treat" thinking that it would be a small, basic but clean b&b - just a bed for the night and a shower in the morning - how wrong I was!! I was not prepared for what we were greeted with. This hovel is in a nasty backstreet - not the sort of place you feel safe walking around - in Victoria. When we got there, we went to "reception" which was a disgusting, smoky basement room and were given the keys to our room. We stayed in our room for all of a 2 minutes and left straight away - it was awful!! We were not expecting much but honestly it was gross: holes in the ceiling with exposed wires, grotty bed sheets (I daren't even look at them properly let alone sleep on them), the paint was peeling off the wall, the curtains were ripped and moulding, the curtain pole was hanging off the wall, I can't comment on the "en suite" as I was too scared to look!! We picked up our bags straight away and got on the first train out of there, I cannot tell you how relieved we were to wake up at home the following morning. I cannot stress this enough: Do not stay there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Chester is adequate”
Reviews.Author: MARGO001
Reviews.Content: Good location near Victoria Station. No breakfast although I found it through a B&B website. Couldn't get into the room early after flying all night. Room was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: WINWINLondon
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE! I have travelled extensively and this place was by far the worst hotel I have every stayed in - I was on a budget but this was not worth it. The staff were immensely unhelpful with absolutely no idea of how to speak to a customer. The hotel itself was shabby and poorly decorated. When I arrived, the hotel was in a state with duvets and sheets just lying in the hallway (clearly they were cleaning up) and this was all removed later on - still not a good start! The 'reception' was a room in the basement where a man sat in a smoke filled and disgustingly messy room. My room was actually not badly decorated but was small. It was probably their best room and it was newly decorated (the only positive thing I have to say might I add). Even the shower and the bathroom was decent (newly decorated) and clean - I thank my lucky stars that I booked the en-suite as the shared toilet and bathroom were atrocious - unclean, unhygienic and just plain DIRTY! The room was advertised as having internet broadband access - BUT IT DID NOT. I had a very poor signal. When I complained the receptionist could do nothing and said that I could sit out on the stairs where the signal was 'excellent'. I payed for a room with internet access not to sit out outside my room to use the wifi - and I should add that I refused to pay the additional fee for internet and the receptionist did not budge or waive the fee despite the access being unavailable in the room! I was desperate to use the internet so coughed up the money unwillingly. Weird noises came from the room periodically (from the heating system). In most hotels, you will find a bible or equivalent in a drawer - what did I find? An 'Adult Guide' to London in the drawer!! What a confused place! ALL IN ALL VERY POOR - STAY AWAY!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: jwalkerphd
Reviews.Content: This hotel is terrible. I arrived to find a team of 'craftsmen' repainting the halls of the hotel and the rooms of the hotel. It was chaos. I was given a hideous room in the basement and when I complained they did give me a slightly better one higher up but it was still awful. This allowed a splendid view of the back yard (as seen in the photos on another review) which was full of junk. There seemed to be no Fire Escape signs or fire extinguishers. Hideous shower, kettle with cups but no tea. I didn't stay and they wouldn't refund me. The staff where not as hostile as mentioned in other reviews and seemd quite friendly or just embarassed. Don't book this hotel and if you do, don't pay in advance as you won't get it back. Why are us poor visitors to London meant to feel grateful if we only pay Â£46.00 for a crappy room, this would get you a nice room in many other capitals, I don't know why the government or the tourist office can't stop hotels ripping people off. You can pay Â£75 one day and then because they're busy it's Â£200 the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Health hazard”
Reviews.Author: london_traveller9
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely gruesome. The room itself was very small but that was understandable for a back street hotel in central London. However, the sheets were washed but still stained!! We decided to unbutton the duvet and remove the pillow case which left us in utter shock, both had patches of grey and various stains. The walls were damp and parts were peeling and the ensuite was equivalent of a porta-loo with a shower of course. We eventually got our room changed but the new one wasn't much better. Quite simply, if you are looking for a hotel in the right location and are not bothered about cleansiness or comfort then this is the place to be as it is right in the heart of London with many shops, restaurants and travel facilities nearby. But value for money???....never.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Value for London”
Reviews.Author: FrugalTravelMom
Reviews.Content: We had booked another hotel (less expensive & it included bkfst), so our family of 4 adults only stayed here the one night they didn't have room for us at the other hotel. The Quad room (two double beds) was a decent price for London, and was clean. The bathroom was tiny, but none of us are tall or hefty! The staff was very friendly and helpful. The young man even walked my husband around the corner to help him find the next hotel we were booked in for the next two nights. A grocery and ATM were just a block or two away. It was a good location for travelling throughout Zone 1 (central London) from Victoria vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Never Never Never Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: coolboy1
Reviews.Content: So funny how despite the rooms being clean etc , the hotel was let down by some of the worst staff I have ever encounter in UK and the World . I booked a ensuite room and in the morning found no hot water in the room . I ventured down to the caretaker and was greeted by a man in his underpants smoking a cigarette , I was told â€œ The fact I had no hot water was not his problem ! and I could use the communal bathroom â€œ . Words cannot say how disgusting this was the bathroom not being cleaned for months etc ... When I asked for breakfast --- again knocking on the caretakers door and again being greeted by the same man in underpants etc etc , I was given token to have breakfast when I asked where it was I was directed to a local kebab shop down the road â€“ Again dirty and terrible â€“ the breakfast was cold and the kebab shop cold and unclean â€“ Please do not stay here if you value your money and sanity !!

Reviews.Title: “repeat visitor”
Reviews.Author: saracenknight48
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit to the Chester; I was there a couple of months ago. Since then, the refurbishment of the other side of the building was complete and I got one of the new rooms. This is an improvement on an experience that was already quite good. It was a very good weekend stay with the family although it was quite cold in London. Very comfortable, spacious rooms; we thoroughly enjoywd ir and we'll certainly come back.

Reviews.Title: “Dont even think about this place”
Reviews.Author: socialbutterflyUk
Reviews.Content: I booked to stay here and then read some horrendous reviews of it, when I arrived it really was as bad as the reviews and the foreign guy who opened the door to me ended up swearing at me as I left the premises cos I refused to stay there afterall. I really hope no one else is subjected to the appaulling experience I was subjected to.

HotelInfo.Name: Chester Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 27-29 Longmoore St | Victoria, London SW1V 1JQ, England
